729044f-a.text:
John Street, slightly south of Innis Street, showing part of the old John SStreet Quarry, long since filled in. This is a set of two views taken at about the same time.
192S
Views 1 and 2
P.L. Snerr

729045f-b.text:
John Street, slightly south of Innis Street, showing, in a set of three vie~s, the John Street cuarry on the Bennett property. Views 2 and 3 show the quarry heing filled in with garbage. The Bayonne Bridce was later constructed across this area.
February, 1925
Views 1,2,3
P. L. Sperr

729047f-c.text:
(1)
John Street, slightly south of Innis Street, showing the dumps which filled in the old John Street stone 4uarry, on the Bennett property. The view is northeastward toward Port Richmond High School.
March 24, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
North across the edge of the duarry, near John and Imnis Street.
March 24, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
A more extensive view across the dumps which filled in the old
stone quarry.
March 24, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.

729048f-b.text:
John Street, slightly south of Innis Street, showing part of the dumps that filled in the old John Street stone quarry on the Bennett property. Mr. Sperr states that this site marks the place of the last pillar of the Bayonne Bridge. The views are toward Newark Avenue and were taken the same day.

March 24, 1928
Views 1-2-3
P. L. Sperr
729048f-b.folder: John Street & Innis Street, Staten Island, NY

729046f-a.text:
(1)
John Street, slightly south of Innis Street, showing the old John Street stone quarry on the Bennett property. The quarry was
later filled in.
February 1925.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
Another view of the quarry.
February 1925.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
A view eastward across the dumps which filled in the quarry.
The view is toward Trantor Place.
March 22, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
